story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: underdog_reveal
primary_trope.hook_text: This Solid race scored higher than Unbound on Length.
primary_trope.mechanism: Von Restorff effect — the outlier demands attention. Underdog arcs trigger prediction error (brain expected low, got high).

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Coast to Coast? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Coast to Coast scored 54 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.text_on_screen: Should You Race Coast to Coast?
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Coast to Coast. Au Gres to Ludington, Michigan. 204 mi. Relatively flat to rolling Michigan gravel crossing the state.
beats.text_on_screen: Coast to Coast | Au Gres to Ludington, Michigan | 204 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Let's go through the scores. Length. 5 out of 5. This race measures commitment in hours, not miles. 204 miles earns maximum respect as ultra-distance that separates endurance racers from weekend warriors. Adventure. 4 out of 5. Serious exploration vibes. Far from pavement. Touching your tire to Lake Huron at sunrise, then racing 204 miles to Lake Michigan creates geographic adventure most races can't match. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Adequate. The word was invented for this. Point-to-point from Au Gres Marina at 6:00 AM to Ludington requires vehicle shuttling or crew coordination. Race Quality. 3 out of 5. Solid production value. Matt Acker co-designed a thoughtful course progressing from farmland through "Manistee National Forest's winding two-tracks" with 85% dirt/gravel. Experience. 3 out of 5. The experience justifies the entry fee. Touching your tire to Lake Huron at sunrise, then racing 204 miles to Lake Michigan creates adventure. Community. 3 out of 5. Community is a real selling point. Sarah Porch highlights Midwest hospitality: "Several residents set up water and cooling stations for the racers. Value. 3 out of 5. Reasonable price for what's offered. 204 miles of varied Michigan terrain from Lake Huron to Lake Michigan typically delivers solid value, though no entry fee data is available. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Mid-range expenses. Budget a proper race weekend.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: And the rest of the scorecard. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Some chunky bits. Nothing catastrophic. Elevation. 2 out of 5. A few hills. Nothing to lose sleep over. Climate. 2 out of 5. Mostly pleasant. Check the forecast anyway. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Known in certain circles. Niche following. Field Depth. 2 out of 5. Enough competition to keep you honest. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Low altitude. Breathe easy.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.narration: What Coast to Coast does well.
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.narration: What they don't put on the website.
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

weaknesses: Relatively flat terrain (less challenging than mountain ultras)

beats.label: LOGISTICS

broll_sources.query: Au Gres to Ludington, Michigan travel guide

beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: Detroit or Grand Rapids - varies by start/finish
Lodging: Au Gres and Ludington have lodging. Book early. Shuttle logistics for 204-mile.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Michigan Ultra-Distance Challenge. If you're in Michigan or the Midwest and want an ultra-distance challenge. yes, it's a well-organized event with unique appeal. If you're traveling from far away. there are more prestigious ultra-distance events elsewhere.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Coast to Coast isn't quite right for you. For better ultra-distance: Unbound XL, Dirty Kanza, Trans Iowa. For similar regional ultras: other Midwest ultra-distance events.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced Coast to Coast? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.

meme_inserts.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style flat cutout character, shocked expression, hidden gem sparkle effect, 'Coast to Coast' bold text, tier badge 'SOLID', high contrast red/yellow/white, cycling gear, handlebar mustache --ar 16:9 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.youtube: Primary platform. SEO-optimize title for '[Race Name] review'.
cross_platform_notes.extract_shorts: Pull 3-5 Shorts: hook, biggest surprise score, verdict.
cross_platform_notes.blog: Cross-reference the race profile page for search traffic.
